https://homestars.com/on/rocky%20view%20county/asbestos-lead-removal,5,https://homestars.com/on/rocky%20view%20county/asbestos-lead-removal,"Asbestos, Lead, and Radon Removal",2861385,http://www.radonwest.com/,/companies/2861385-radon-west?searched_category_id=312&service_area=1998265,"Radon West Ltd. is one of Canada’s most engaged companies in the radon industry.
We are a C-NRPP certified, full service radon and building science company, for both commercial and residential projects.
We also mitigate radon levels in existing buildings, install new construction details, and provide radon related certification and continuing education training.
Our services also include testing, design, analysis, inspections, research and development as well as consultation.
We develop and maintain NORM management programs to meet Occupational Health and Safety requirements.

Our technical expertise in the understanding of building science and system design ensures that the final installation is the best fit for the many factors that influence radon infiltration such as construction type, climate, geology, and the operating systems of a building.
We specialize in technical diagnostics and challenging projects.

We are a recognized industry leader in the radon services industry and are known nationally for our high-quality work and for our science-based design of effective and efficient radon control systems specific to Canada’s cold climate.

Two of our founders built their own home in 2006.  They had heard about radon but were assured by almost everyone they talked to that it was not a problem in Alberta.  A couple of years later they decided to test anyway and were surprised with the findings.  They had radon in their home above the acceptable levels.  They reduced their levels and then started to test the homes of family and friends.  42% of them had levels higher than the acceptable guidelines.  One founder’s levels were so high that based on the United States Environmental Protection Agency guidelines her family should have evacuated their home within 3 months.  They had been living in the home for 8 years with their young children.  Hence, in 2012 Radon West Ltd. was born in 2012.  Now our team of 7 operates out of a head office in Okotoks, Alberta as well as field locations in Cochrane and Calgary.

Our understanding of the science behind radon entry and mitigation has created our reputation as a “different kind” of radon professional.  Our company is science driven and with that comes curiosity and exploring different ways to do things.  We are well equipped to more than just the standard radon testing and mitigation that is common in the industry.

The majority of radon reduction systems in Canada are depressurization systems for which we have a defined process that ensures we are designing systems specific to the building.  It begins with a site assessment to help define scope and develop budget for mitigation activities.  Next, we perform detailed diagnostics to determine natural pressure, design pressure and minimum target pressure for effective radon protection.  Then we develop soil resistance and pipe resistance measurements to allow for an accurate estimate of the depressurization fan characteristics required for the design.  Next, we apply temperature correction factors to ensure systems will work in the coldest time of the year. Construction of the sub-slab mitigation system according to design and budget is completed and documented in a detailed as-built application relating to the project.  The system is commissioned and a short-term test is performed to verify system effectiveness.  Some systems require different mitigation techniques, such as HVAC changes, but each building is different and the best mitigation type can only be determined once testing and diagnostics have been completed.

We have experience managing large-scale testing projects.  In the last 2 years we have managed test distribution, quality assurance and quality control activities for more than 10,000 buildings.  We follow stringent quality control/assurance protocols.

We also offer residential test kits for home owners.  Our kits are different than most others because we complete the same stringent quality control and assurance testing so homeowners have the same quality when testing their home themselves.
If there are areas where the UofC processes significant quantities of groundwater, Radon West has experience quantifying the contribution of processing groundwater on the radon level.
Radon emanation from building materials (flux) testing:
In the unlikely event that radon emanation is thought to be a significant factor
column2: we have the ability to quantify the impact of radon emanation inhouse.

column1: Certain types of radon mitigation systems can create gamma radiation issues.  We have the equipment and knowledge to measure and analyze gamma radiation.

Radon is our business and we recognize how and which parts of the building code are directly related to radon.  We can evaluate and understand how different technologies and products can improve or impede the ultimate goal of radon reduction.

Radon entry and mitigation is all about building science.  We need to understand how the building is operating before we can remediate efficiently and effectively.  We use blower doors, duct blasters, thermal imaging cameras and smoke machines, etc.  We consider these building science skills invaluable however few people in the industry have them.

As with any science-based company we know that increased information drives better technologies, processes and policy.  We collaborate with other specialized scientists, like sound engineers for example, to help improve and develop new techniques for both radon testing and mitigation to make systems less intrusive, more energy efficient and effective.

We are one of only four C-NRPP approved trainers in Canada and the only one in Western Canada that provides certification and continuing education courses in the field of radon measurement and mitigation.

https://homestars.com/on/rocky%20view%20county/asbestos-lead-removal,5,https://homestars.com/on/rocky%20view%20county/asbestos-lead-removal,"Asbestos, Lead, and Radon Removal",2957910,https://sealtechrestorations.com,/companies/2957910-sealtech-restorations?searched_category_id=312&service_area=2257154," If you believe your home may have mould growing in damp or moisture-prone areas of your home, it is imperative that you contact a specialist in mould removal for Calgary homes. If you have a home that was built before the 1980s, and has insulating material in it that may contain asbestos, we urge you to consult a residential asbestos removal company such as Sealtech Restorations in Calgary. We can help you determine whether or not it would be feasible for the asbestos to be removed from your home.

Asbestos fibres and other hazardous particles can cause serious health problems when inhaled over a long period of time. By being proactive and consulting with professionals that specialize in abatement and remediation services, you’ll have peace of mind knowing that you took the necessary precautions to ensure your home or commercial structure is asbestos free, and waste-free of any other potentially hazardous materials.
If you’d like to have your home, commercial or industrial property checked for asbestos or other hazardous waste, contact us for more information or for a free estimate today.
Do-It-Yourself versus Professional Mould Removal in Calgary

Seen in an array of colours from dark black to a light green, mould is a common, harmful substance in homes requiring mould removal in Calgary. While there are certain moulds that are not particularly harmful to your health, there are toxic strands of black mould that can cause serious health risks for you and your family, ranging from respiratory symptoms to death. Aside from the alarming health risks of mould, mould can also cause damage to your home. Mould is notorious for ruining carpet, woodwork, flooring, and drywall.

Mould can be found growing anywhere that moisture and dampness can be found. Common areas of the home for mould to be found include basements, attics, bathrooms, and anywhere else moisture has reached. While mould removal services range in price based on the severity and the spread, a mould removal specialist can have your home mould-free and safe in anywhere from 1 to 5 days. You may be tempted to attempt to remove the mould from your home through do-it-yourself measures in an attempt to save money. However, a professional mould removal service is the best option because:
Mould is a challenging substance to remove, sometimes hiding in unseen places
column2: if all mould is not removed properly, it could come back or spread again.

column1: Mould removal is a complex process and disturbing the mould site can stir up the harmful toxins, immediately contaminating the air of your home.
Mould situations are often much larger than they originally appear
column2: as you begin to remove or clean mould from areas of your home, you may begin to expose a much larger mould problem than you initially realized.

column1: Mould can spread very quickly and can pose huge risks to the health and wellness of your family. Any time you see mould, it is best to contact a professional mould removal in Calgary specialist to discuss your options and assess the severity of your situation. Sealtech Restorations has provided mould removal services for years. Give us a call today.
